attributes.action: The independent election of the director general of the BBC.
attributes.background: There are numerous cases recently where the journalistic integrity and neutrality of the British Broadcasting Corporation has come into question.  The neutrality of the BBC is essential in order for the British people to make informed decisions regarding Politics in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Permit a one off national holiday celebrating immigrants and their contributions
attributes.background: In light of recent doubts raised across multiple spectrums about the benefits of immigration we believe it is time for immigrants to reveal their true value the country. By staging a single one off strike/national holiday the impact of the U.K. without immigrants might be better understood.

attributes.action: Divert the £4,000,000 spent on Homeopathy to a Mental Health Awareness Campaign.
attributes.background: Every year, the NHS spends around £4 to £5 million on Homeopathy, a remedial pratice which has been repeatedly examined and found to have no long term health benefit other than placebo. This money could find better use as a national mental health awareness campaign to help curtail MH stigmatisation.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2010 review into homeopathy found that it was a 'placebo treatment'.
http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-archive/science-technology/s-t-homeopathy-inquiry/

This is an example of a mental health campaign which could be better funded with the extra money available from ceasing to fund homeopathy.
http://www.time-to-change.org.uk/

attributes.action: Prior to invoking Article 50 UK Gov should renegotiate EU reform & hold 2nd Ref
attributes.background: The UK Gov to work alongside EU Gov's & the EU Comm to Reform EU Treaties prior to invoking Article 50 and then put a second IN/OUT Referendum to the UK electorate on the basis of delivering material change since the 1st Referendum. This is the pragmatic way forward and will keep the Union intact.
attributes.additional_details: It is clear that the UK OUT vote has sent shock waves across Europe and that the Euro Politicians are now coming to terms that they will need to be open to renegotiation and reform whereas previously they were complacent & intransient particularly as they face similar Eurosceptism and calls for similar IN/OUT referendums from their own electorate as things stand. It is time for Europe to reform and it is time for the UK to lead these discussions now that the European elite are in listening mode.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists to use cycle paths where provided
attributes.background: Cycle paths are created and funded for one sole reason, safety to cyclists and motorists, where provided it should be a legal requirement for cyclists to use the cycle paths to reduce danger to them and motorists on UK roads, especially those which are 60mph speed limits.

attributes.action: Replace subsidies for green energy (FITs)  with a loan guarantee scheme.
attributes.background:
Producing green energy has become more viable as cost of deployment has reduced drastically (IRENA).
Loan guarantees would enable more schemes to be built than subsidies (FITs) and could potentially negate the need for the nuclear plant at Hinkley whilst contributing towards environmental targets.
attributes.additional_details:
Government subsidies (FITs) for medium/large scale green energy schemes have been reduced.  
New schemes face difficulty in raising finance because lenders are unable to analyse the risk/reward the sector represents.  
Finance contributes to the 25 Giga Watts held up and awaiting deployment (DECC April 2016).  
A rolling scheme of up to £5 billion could replace the need for Hinkley Point C to be built providing 3200+ MW of green energy.
Example:  www.greensaturn.com/content/pages/renewablesnothinkley

attributes.action: Only one councillor should represent a ward in the local councils.
attributes.background: Derbyshire PCC Mr Hardayal Dhindsa is a local councillor as well. PCC role is quite demanding and a full time position, still Mr Dhindsa decided to continue as a Councillor. This shows that three councillors aren't needed to represent a ward specially when in Sandwell 71 out of 72 are from Labour.
attributes.additional_details: In Derby there are total of 17 wards and every ward has 3 councillors. Interestingly if all three are from the same party then it becomes quite pointless to have them. There is no job description and position doesn't have any accountability. One tory councillor kept on getting paid while he lived abroad. Also councils like Sandwell only have Labour councillors and that has been the case for ages. Local democracy is failing and need urgent reforms.

attributes.action: Restore Capital punishment for terrorists & killers of our police & Armed Forces
attributes.background:
Capital Punishment was abolished in 1969.
and for treason was abolished in 1998
With the ever increasing global threat from terrorism, now is the time to restore Capital punishment
Those who seek to murder by terrorism or kill our armed forces and police should pay the ultimate price
attributes.additional_details:
With the heinous murder of Lee Rigby by terrorists, it showed how great the threat to our country really was.
Those who would seek to murder our citizens, Armed Forces and police should face the ultimate sanction.
Furthermore, there is now a fresh threat to our shores from Irish terrorists.
It is time that Capital punishment for the offences of terrorism, murder of Armed Forces and police was brought back on to the statute books.
The evil cowards who cause death and destruction deserve no less

attributes.action: Reduce Animal testing and put harsher rules in place when testing on animals
attributes.background: I have never been a fan of animal testing but I believe without it we wouldn't have the scientific knowledge that we have now. I would like the government to put harsher rules on animal testing and also for companies to have to display that they test on animals on the labels of their products.
attributes.additional_details:
A little more information... Some of the rules that I believe should be put in place:

-Any animal that is tested on should immediately be released and   
given the best quality of life possible or be put down. They should also be given freedom while being tested on.
-Any company that tests on animals should be forced to make a 
minimum donation to charities that support any animal wellbeing. 
-Any company or brand that tests on animals must display this on their packaging in the UK.

attributes.action: Link all public sector salaries to MPs' salaries (Backdated to April 2014)
attributes.background: Since April 2014, MPs' salaries have increased by 10.3%, whereas most  working in the public sector have seen salary stagnation. The goal of this petition is to link the increase of public sector salaries with MPs' salaries both backdated to April 2014 and in the future.

attributes.action: No assessments for DLA recipients when changing to PIP
attributes.background:
For people with long term disabilities that will not get better

If you have lost limbs, or an invisible disabilities such as Dyspraxia, Autism, or any disability that will never get better. ( There are loads of examples I could mention) You should not have to be reassessed for PIP.

attributes.action: Stop organisations from charging more for not making payment by Direct Debit.
attributes.background: Direct debit gives a third party open access to your wallet and bank account at any time and at will. Those who pay by other LEGAL methods are penalized with higher fees. In effect its a stealth tax charged by companies who want easy access to YOUR money. Its not right, Its not moral and its unjust.
attributes.additional_details:
If funds are not available or a payments going into account are not there on time due to bank errors or delays in employee payments or benefit payments it can cause LIFE THREATENING problems for those on a low budget as bank fees are taken from allowances put aside for food or essentials. This puts incredible pressure those on a tight budget who are hit the most with unrealistic fees for returned direct debits forcing them into further debt.

This is immoral for modern day British Companies.

attributes.action: Support the provision of new bomb detection equipment to Baghdad checkpoints.
attributes.background: On the 2nd of July, 165 innocent Iraqis were killed in the Karrada district of Baghdad in a massive explosion near a shopping mall by car bomb- a truck to be precise.  Another car bomb explosion took the lives of around 100 innocent shoppers at a market in Baghdad a month before. The list is long.
attributes.additional_details: There are many Checkpoints in Baghdad. Police are still using fake bomb detectors bought via a bogus British businessman who was jailed in the UK over the deal 3 years ago. Iraqi Prime minister called for an end to their use. It is frustrating to see that so many innocent lives could be saved using modern security technologies, which the UK is a world leader in. I call on the British government to openly support the Iraqi authority in replacing bomb detection equipment at checkpoints.

attributes.action: The UK should not leave the EU until all devolved assemblies of the UK agree.
attributes.background: The non-binding EU referendum has shown a simple majority for the 'leave the EU' option. However the results represent the majority view of the English and Welsh but not of voters in Scotland, Northern Ireland and London. It would undemocractic to force this result on the UK as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: The vote has not produced a clear mandate from the whole of the United Kingdom. There is now a very real risk of the UK disintegrating if this vote is simply seen as a mandate to remove the UK from the EU. The Government may accept the the result as advisory, but should now discuss will all devolved assemblies and with the EU as to a means of obtaining a compromise on the views expressed by this divided nation.

attributes.action: Protect our marine and terrestrial environment after brexit
attributes.background: The UK was bound under EU law to protect the marine and terrestrial environment, this could be threatened due to the referendum. The Water Framework Directive, Habitat Directive, Marine Litter Directive and Bird Directive, all protected these environments. It is important we still follow these.
attributes.additional_details:
These Directives actively reduce pollution, monitor it and help reduce. At the same time it protects wildlife, it would be a backward step for the UK not to monitor and actively take part in these directives. The environment is something we should all treasure and it does not respect boundaries as we do. We must work with the EU to make this work even though we have voted out. 
It is important that fishing quotas remain to protect the future of our fish and seas, or soon there will be no fish.

attributes.action: To require a two-thirds majority vote for all referendums in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
A referendum on a national level is meant to be a means for parliament to secure popular consent on issues that leave government divided, or when there is special need for a vote of public support.

This cannot be done when important constitutional changes are decided with a 1-5% majority.
attributes.additional_details:
With turnout in referendums generally falling, the UK needs to adapt it's rules according to voting so that two-thirds majority is required. The UK needs to factor in the fact that turnout will never be 100%, and that 51% of anything less than that is not an actual majority.

A two-thirds majority vote would secure popular consent on every level referendums are held, ensuring that government would have a genuine majority to grant the decision legitimacy regardless of voter turnout.

attributes.action: Ban smoking on footpaths, walkways and public places
attributes.background: Passive smoking is becoming a serious health issue, specifically in urban area. Every morning, thousands of non-smokers have to face passive smoking while going to work as other people smoke on footpaths and walkways. A large number of people do not use designated smoking zones.
attributes.additional_details:
A quick look at this article from Cancer Research UK will tell us how dangerous passive smoking can be - http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking

Unwanted passive smoking on the streets of major UK cities is causing health issues that are not very easy to detect in early stages. Overall, passive smoking is affecting the health of non-smokers living or working in urban areas in a significant way.

attributes.action: All NHS trusts should provide dual diagnosis treatment
attributes.background:
When mental health problems and substance misuse co-exist, this is known as a dual diagnosis. 22-44% of all adult inpatients in England also have a substance misuse problem and 22% of all suicides are linked to alcohol use.

Why are so many people falling through the net?
attributes.additional_details:
Many NHS trusts simply refuse to make a mental health diagnosis if the individual is under the influence of alcohol.  Without an assessment, an appropriate referral cannot be made and treatment cannot be given, leaving the individual to continue self-medicating while their physical and mental health deteriorates. 

Sectioning or suicide shouldn't be the only options left. 

Early intervention is vital. More funding is needed. More training. More communication. More person-centred treatment.

attributes.action: Pass law to impound vehicles/caravans of travellers who damage public land.
attributes.background: Recently a travellers community has twice descended on our village, and twice been rapidly evicted by the local Council. The travellers, who act with a wholesome contempt for the law, have twice caused an indescribable and costly mess. This is a UK-wide problem. It's time to stop to this behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: If a group of travellers dumps vast quantities of bulk rubbish and human waste while they occupy public land, it costs tax payers' money to clean up. In these circumstances, the group's behaviour forfeits their right to live in this way. If they knew they could lose their vehicles/caravans, maybe they would behave differently. It's time to put a stop to this anti-social behaviour. Sign the petition and let's get our MPs to raise this issue in a Parliamentary debate!”

attributes.action: Make it illegal for people to smoke while in charge of a motor vehicle.
attributes.background: Using a mobile phone behind the wheel in the UK is banned because it's distracting and causes accidents, so why isn't smoking behind the wheel illegal too. It's dangerous for drivers as only one hand is likely to be present, but also distracting to roll, find and light a cigarette.
attributes.additional_details: Attention is key while driving and smoking distracts you fully from the road. It should not be allowed to promote safety in cars and also healthier living in the population.

attributes.action: Give police the powers to enforce immediate punishments to noisy neighbours
attributes.background: On two occasions now, my family have been victim to noisy neighbours, playing music and shouting throughout the night. The severity of this needs to be addressed and police need to be given powers to immediately seize equipment or enforce other methods to give the victim some respite.
attributes.additional_details: Action needs to be taken on this issue as individuals do become suicidal due to the lack of support from authorities and police. It is not widely documented how much of an effect anti-social and noisy neighbours can have on people. While environmental services can investigate the issue, this can take a long time and people get desperate. The police need powers to tackle the situation right there and then. If their music is too loud, seize the equipment instantly. Harassment, take them into custody.

attributes.action: Ban the taking of photographs of children in school without the child's consent
attributes.background: The concept of private life is a broad one which encompasses the right to identity.  A pupil's image reveals his or her unique characteristics and constitutes one of the chief attributes of his or her personality.
attributes.additional_details: A child, over the age of 12, must be able to give or withdraw consent to the taking of his or her images in addition to the wishes and feelings of the parents/legal guardians.  At present, there are guidelines published by the Information Commissioners Office as to the taking of photographs at schools.  We argue that this is not sufficient because the use of personal mobile phones within a class room setting by a tutor is not prohibited.

attributes.action: Request that the government revoke Govia's contract for Southern Rail
attributes.background:
Southern Rail customers are fed up with the continued poor service -cancelled trains, late trains, trains will less cars than normal, poor compensation.
This is also starting to affect employees and employers when people are continually late or need to leave early

attributes.action: legislate to pay travel time from home as paid work to first job and last
attributes.background: Time spent travelling to and from first and last jobs by workers who do not have a fixed office should be regarded as work and should go on time sheet as paid work as workers are being stopped 10 hours per week
attributes.additional_details: the European Court of Justice judgement ruled those without a fixed or habitual office should consider the time they spend travelling between their homes and the premises of their first and last jobs as part of their hours for the day

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: Host a Referendum for an English National Anthem.
attributes.background: Our proposal of a public referendum would be an effective way of allowing the people of England to choose for themselves how they wish to express their identity in our family of nations. Just as Wales are permitted with Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau, and Scotland with Flower of Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: https://web.archive.org/web/20100615152120/http://www.weareengland.org/news.asp?itemid=327&itemTitle=England+announce+victory+anthem+for+Delhi+chosen+by+the+public%21&section=115&sectionTitle=News

attributes.action: Make all technical sporting goods in the UK tax free to encourage participation
attributes.background: Cycling has increased in popularity immensely since the success of the 2012 Olympics and due to the Government's cycle to work scheme allowing tax free purchasing of cycle equipment. I would like to see all technical sporting goods to be tax free to encourage more people to take up sport in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Olympic success in 2012 and 2016 has shown that the UK has the ability to be a great sporting nation. We should encourage more sporting participation and a healthier lifestyle by allowing tax free purchases on all technical sporting goods and not just for those in full time employment. Clothing would be exempt but hardware would be tax free. E.G bicycles, helmets, running trainers, weight training equipment, trekking poles, climbing equipment etc anything which encourages sporting activity.

attributes.action: Introduce Apprenticeship's for 30-40 year olds
attributes.background: For 10 years,people born between 1976 &1982 have not been eligible to gain better training for their futures. The "Credit Crunch" forced thousands of workers into unemployment. As an "unskilled worker",an apprenticeship would give work vision and hope for those people who have lost it.

attributes.action: Petition the new New Prime mimister
attributes.background:
The British People demand that When the next Conservative Leader is elected They Sign a Statement of intent Has to when They will invoke Article 50 Before the end of 2016
To reasure the Business World stability And the British Nation
attributes.additional_details:
It is now important that the Goverment 
Stand and deliver on the democratic vote of this nation and come clean on there intentions No more dirty tricks lies and misleading information When will article 50 or Preferably article 72 be signed

attributes.action: Change the legislation, so that Non Binary people are recognised under the law
attributes.background: Currently, the only genders recognised under the law are 'Male' and 'Female'. This makes people who do not identify as either gender uncomfortable and is discrimative. Please change this legislation.
attributes.additional_details: It has emerged, in the recent report, allowing Transgender people to change their gender, on their passport, without a medical certificate. This is a big step, but there's much further to go. The 'X' box gender should be allowed, and therefore this legislation should be changed, recognising all gender identities, be that to one, all or no genders. Everyone is valid and deserves to be represented.

attributes.action: Stop the HMRC phone number being a premium rate and make it free.
attributes.background:
This number is mainly used by people on a low income, elderly people on pensions and those that are registered disabled.
It's charging the people that are less fortunate and really can't afford it.
And average call to the tax office I have found has been 30minutes minimum

attributes.action: Call a second EU Referendum based on independently verified Facts.
attributes.background: Based on the realization that significantly misleading and inaccurate misinformation and untruths have been officially used and admitted to influence the EU referendum. We demand the first referendum be declared void and a second and final referendum be held considering the following:-
attributes.additional_details:
•One communication be compiled and sent out to all the population containing the same agreed number of pages for each party.
•Each party be limited to three sections to complete along the lines of the following:
1. THE FACTS – These must be independently verified.
2. ASPIRATIONS 
3. A CLEAR REALISTIC PLAN OF HOW THESE ASPIRATIONS WILL BE ACHIEVED. 	
Illustrations limited to statistical and information that they contain independently verified.
We demand proven facts, not deception.

attributes.action: Implement 3 month cooling off period for the EU referendum
attributes.background: We call upon the UK Government and Opposition parties to implement a cooling off period for the EU referendum so that a second ballot is required 3 months from now to verify the publics intent to leave once they have understood some of the actual implications of the UK leaving the EU.
attributes.additional_details: There were many claims and counter claims made during the EU referendum and a heated and heady level of debate. The decision is a crucial one for our country and can't be taken lightly. Over the coming 3 months more data and evidence of the implications (positive and negative) will become clearer as discussions are had and ideas explored. The decision is so momentous that we believe the public should be asked to confirm their decision to leave after a 3 month cooling off period.

attributes.action: Raise awareness for Seat Back Failure, putting your children's lives at risk.
attributes.background: During a rear impact crash our front seats fully reclined with force, we have been informed this is standard from 'cheap' cars- ours was a 2014 model.  This happens with all makes and models potentially putting passenger's lives at risk. This Is unacceptable and higher standards are needed.
attributes.additional_details: Our mechanic informed us it is expected from cheaper cars as they use low quality seats, more expensive makes use higher quality. We believe there should be a standard of seats used, we are told to put our children in the back of our cars- unbeknownst to us potentially putting their lives at risk should they be in a crash! The front seats fly back at force, along with the person in them and the passengers in the back are flung forward- it's so very very dangerous.

attributes.action: Ban children under the age of 12 being sold sugary or high sugar content drinks
attributes.background:
Sugary drinks are proven to cause numerous health issues and have a high risk factor to health. Children should not be able to buy sugary drinks and should only be purchased with a parent or adult.
Children are not educated on health and this may promote healthy living through a ban.
attributes.additional_details:
The government do not do enough to educate children to the risk factors or unhealthy food and drink choices. Sugary drinks are the leading contributing factors to poor health in children and adults. 
Sugary drinks cause many health issues such as, Cancers, Diabetes, heart disease, dental issues, mood swings, hormonal imbalances, high blood pressure, acne, skin conditions and being obese or overweight.

attributes.action: Ban all chocolate made by child labour from entering the UK.
attributes.background: Thousands of children from different parts of the world are captured and sold into slavery to work on cocoa plantation farms for the use of large chocolate companies. Sign this petition to help these children gain back their rights and freedom.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently over 27 million slaves world-wide and 9 million of these are children sold into various trades. 

We want to help tackle this issue by first tackling the chocolate trade by banning chocolate that is cultivated by children from entering the UK. This ban would raise world-wide awareness on an issue, which is currently being ignored.

attributes.action: Make the Work Capability Assessment illnesss specific
attributes.background: The Work Capability Assessments for the past five years have been heavily directed towards physical disability which is irrelevant to those suffering from mental illnesses. This makes it almost impossible for anybody with a mental illness to be assessed accordingly.
attributes.additional_details: Examples of the assessments carried out for all claimants, regardless of their condition, be it mental or physical include: reaching, standing and sitting, absence or loss of control of the bowel, consciousness during waking moments and picking up or moving and transferring. This is part of a long list of many assessments which do not relate to mental illness. This has meant that people with mental health problems, signed off work by a doctor and or psychiatrist are often declared fit for work, resulting in a decline in their health and often suicide. We ask that the assessments are specific to the disability of the claimant in order to obtain a fair assessment of that individual's disability.

attributes.action: Scrap car tax and put 1p on a litre of fuel.
attributes.background: Scrapping car tax (ved) and putting 1p on fuel will ensure everyone who drives pays the same, regardless of engine size, and no one can evade paying excise duty on fuel.

attributes.action: Bring back public information films showing the dangers HGV drivers face
attributes.background: HGV drivers are constantly put in danger due to the way that other road users behave toward us when a car joins a motorway or pulls out into the line of on coming HGVs and explaining safe distances
attributes.additional_details: Increasing dash cam footage found on most online forums within the industry

attributes.action: Raise university tuition fees using current CPI, not forecasted RPIX
attributes.background: This petition urges the government to use CPI (currently at 0.5%) to increase tuition fees instead of the 2.8% forecasted rate from the Office of Budget Responsibility. This rate will benefit students more, whilst also covering the cost of inflation for universities.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the HE Bill universities are already publishing new tuition fees of £9250 per year, an increase of just under 2.8%. Currently, no rate of inflation published by ONS is close to 2.8% and RPIX, the rate the government is making calculations on, is only 1.5%. 2.8% is a 10 year forecast for RPIX. To put tutition fees in line with inflation a new tuition fee should be calculated each year using CPI figures at the time.

attributes.action: Re enact the 1955 canal closure act of parliament.
attributes.background: The Northern reaches of the Lancaster canal were cut off from the main line in 1968.To make way for the M6 motorway,the Locks were de commissioned and the canal was severed in several locations.We propose restoration by stages,to encourage New businesses ,especially tourism.
attributes.additional_details: We have support from numerous boating ,restoration societies.And over 500 members of our group.OWD LANKY BOATERS.Both parish and county councils have show support also.

attributes.action: Make age appropriate basic life support mandatory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background:
Give all children a chance to be life savers with age appropriate basic life support mandatory in the national curriculum in every school year.
Starting with getting help, calling 999, and going on to Asthma, Anaphylaxis, AEDs, CPR, Choking, and more.
attributes.additional_details: AEDs are automated external defibrillators, safe to use and already found in many published places such as train stations and malls.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking Except in Designated Areas
attributes.background:
There has been lots of scientific research done on passive smoking. It shows that passive smoking is just as bad as actually smoking. When someone is smoking nearby you're breathing in their smoke as well. 
Therefore smoking should be banned outside as well as inside except in designated areas.

attributes.action: Establish a 7 day celebration of tireless efforts by NHS workers 365 days a year
attributes.background: My mum recently attended Hospital for a hip replacement where she was cared for by many wonderful NHS workers over a five day period including a weekend. I felt that my few words of appreciation to the staff needed reinforcing through a national campaign aimed at thanking all NHS workers in the UK.

attributes.action: Introduce a maximum term limit for the role of UK Prime Minister
attributes.background: Many countries limit the time that one individual can hold the highest political office. This prevents one individual from dominating the political agenda for too long and amassing too much power. Thus it helps to guard against authoritarianism and the domination of particular interest groups.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of countries in the world have term limits for their Heads of State. This is a widely accepted international norm.

Often these limits apply to presidents rather than prime ministers. However, since the UK is a monarchy, and the Prime Minister is more powerful than the monarch in policy making, it is appropriate to impose such a limit on UK prime ministers.

At a time when the personal power of political leaders is so important, this law is critical to preserving political freedoms.

attributes.action: Prevent privatisation of any aspect of Children's Protective Services in the UK
attributes.background: Children deserve to be protected by a system that is not privately controlled and therefore accountable to shareholders. Children's Protective Services must remain within Local Authority control as a Statutory Duty to protect children from avoidable harm.
attributes.additional_details:
Privitisation may allow confused prioritIes for providers that could lead to vulnerable children being abused.

We all have a duty to safeguard children which is a public necessity not a private and financial one.

attributes.action: Gelatine in our food must be marked what animal it is from and in bold writing.
attributes.background: Gelatine is in our food, sweets, pharmaceutical products and many other products. If a product contains Gelatine, it must be written what animal it is from and it must be in bold writing. Food products that contain Gelatine must be clearly marked in bold writing Not suitable for vegetarians.

attributes.action: Review family courts and cafcass mode of operation and predjudicial views.
attributes.background: A request that a Parliamentary commitee be set up to review the way family courts are conducted, the basis of evidence that they and cafcass depend on to make decisions, and the way family courts and CAFCASS are biased towards the mothers wishes over the fathers, more importantly the childs needs.
attributes.additional_details:
It is widely viewed amongst society that fathers are heavily penalised in child contact cases, and that all support is heavily biased towards mothers. 

Many fathers are wrongfully accused and a scan of mothers forums show evidence of collaboration in what accusations to make to prevent/limit contact. CAFCASS are complicit in these activities and their case workers highly prejudiced. Mothers are not held accountable for falsifying accusations.

attributes.action: Lowering the state pension age for women born in the 50s back to 60 years old.
attributes.background: My mother was born on the 10th december 1953, if she was born 4 days earlier she would have retired 2 and half years ago. I'm sure a lot of the country is in the same situation. There wasn't enough time for people born in the 50s to save. This needs to change back to the state pension age of 60.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a persons next of kin to overrule a donor card.
attributes.background: At the moment a persons next of kin can refuse to donate your organs even if you have registered yourself as an organ donor. This is unfair, the whole point of registering yourself means you wish to donate and next of kin should not be able to go against this.
